oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Curly Putman & Bobby Braddock Interview by John Lomax III
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Curly Putman and Bobby Braddock by John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 10-26-81.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Curly Putman; Bobby Braddock;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:00) -- Bobby Braddock describes his personal writing style and co-writing with others. (0:40) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock about the loneliness of writing music by yourself. (1:17) -- Bobby Braddock mentions his fondness of co-writing with Curly Putman. (1:37) -- John Lomax asks Bobbby Braddock about dealing with songwriting dry spells. (2:30) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock about his past BMI awards and worst years for songwriting. (3:02) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock about struggling with songwriting and getting his music on the market. (4:20) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock about his ability to create songs from a woman's perspective. (6:17) -- John Lomax asks about Bobby Braddock's song, "Hard Times." (7:00) -- Bobby Braddock mentions that he wrote "Golden Ring" for George Jones and Tammy Wynette with Rafe Van Hoy. (7:35) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock about his preferred instrument to write songs on. Bobby mentions that he prefers piano over guitar. (8:58) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock how a newer writer could gain access to a publisher. (9:30) -- Bobby Braddock speaks positively about the work environment of Tree Publishing Company. (10:44) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock about the potential of songs he has planned for release. (11:36) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock about his association with BMI. Bobby Braddock mentions that he feels neutrally about BMI and ASCAP as a writer. (12:16) -- John Lomax asks Bobby Braddock whether his personal turmoil has helped his songwriting. (13:42) -- Curly Putman describes co-writing with Bobby Braddock.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Putman, Curly; Braddock, Bobby;
